intro: Elaeodendron psilocarpum, commonly known as the psilocarpum elaeodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It is not known for producing psychoactive compounds, unlike some other species in the same family. Elaeodendron psilocarpum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
